results.title: Barbarian diplomacy
results.creator_credit: Peter Minns, BBC and Oxford Film and Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Chris Patten’s east and west”.
First of the three part documentary series “Chris Patten’s East and West” written and presented by the former British governor of Hong Kong, Chris Patten. In this episode Patten focuses on China - socially, economically and politically - from its past history to the China of the 90s. He more specifically deals with human rights and economic reform emphasising his strong belief that it is important “to keep trade and human rights separate” and that “economical reform requires political reform”. The program covers President Nixon’s visit and his meeting with Mao Tse-tung in 1972; the US/China alliance and lifting of trade restrictions; the rise of Deng Xaioping and the reform movement following Mao’s death; the Tiananmen Square massacre of 1989; international and trade relations at the expense of human rights recognition; President Clinton’s visit in 1998. Also briefly looks at human rights issues in Burma through an interview with the Burmese Opposition Leader, Aung San Suu Kyi who has been politically isolated under house arrest for over 9 years, followed by a comparison to Taiwan, a mainly Chinese capitalist society, democratic and free and a thorn in China’s side. Includes interviews with Henry Kissinger (US National Security Adviser 1969-75), Paul Wolfowitz (US Assistant Secretary of State, Asia 1982-86), Winston Lord (US Foreign Policy Adviser 1970-73) and Sir Alan Donald (British Ambassador, Beijing 1988-91) among others. Contains b&w archival footage and stills.

results.title: Chouans! (Cinemascope Print)
results.creator_credit: Philippe De Broca and Ariel Zeitoun
results.brief_description:
Aristocrat, philosopher and inventor, Count Savinien de Kerfadec loses his wife as she gives birth to their daughter, Celine. The same night he brings home Aurele, a newborn he found of the doorstep of the church. A few years later, young Tarquin who is on his way to the seminar, runs away and becomes the third addition to the eccentric Kerfadec household. As the children grow up, a love triangle develops, until the day the boys are sent away to make their way in the world. In 1793, Tarquin comes back to Brittany as a representant of the Republic, in charge of repressing the uprising in the Western provinces and possibly woe Celine. But Aurele and Celine, whose love for each other has blossomed, are active among those called ‘Les Chouans’.

Credits: Producer, Ariel Zeitoun ; director, Philippe de Broca ; writers, Daniel Boulanger, Philippe de Brocca, Jerome Tonnerre ; photography, Bernard Zitzermann ; music, Georges Delerue.
Cast: Sopphie Marceau, Lambert Wilson, Philippe Noiret, Stephane Freiss, Jean-Pierre Cassel, Roger Dumas.

results.title: Christ Is Risen
results.creator_credit: William Canning, Colin Low and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Focuses on the Easter service in the Russian Orthodox Church of St Peter and St Paul in Montreal. The depth of the emotion touched by this ancient ceremony is reflected in the film. Filmed in a shadowy, taper-lit space, sonorous with chanting voices, and coloured with occasional views of icons and frescos, the film shows an absorbing religious experience.

results.title: Chocolate
results.brief_description: Shows people, including Woody Allen, Jonathon Winters and Jo Ann Worley, tasting a cocoa bean and trying to guess what it was. The film depicts, without narration, the manufacture of chcolate from the extraction of the nuts from the cocoa buds to the addition of sugar to the chocolate powder.

results.title: Chocolat [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Claire Denis, Alain Belmondo, Gerald Crosnier, Cerito Films, La Sept and Oceania Produzioni Internazionali Cinematografiche
results.brief_description: Memories of a childhood in a remote part of the French Cameroons provides the basis for this subtle, partly autobiographical, portrait of a colonial society. France (a surrogate for the filmmaker), revisiting the Cameroons, flashes back to scenes of her youth when her father was a French colonial official. The precarious equilibrium of their household (the mother is attracted to a young black servant) is disturbed by the sudden arrival of a group of outsiders, both European and African, after the forced landing of their plane nearby. The sharpness of the observation and the performances - each of the outsiders represents a different perspective on Africa - prevents the film from sliding into easy nostalgia for a time and way of life long since past. Cast: Isaach de Bankole, Giulia Boschi, Francois Cluzet, Jean-Claude Adelin. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Chip Carving
results.brief_description: Chip carving is a wonderfully direct and simple way to decorate furniture, cabinets, boxes and plaques. Discusses the basics: how to approach design, sharpen the knife, hold a consistent angle and use it to carve four different borders, a rosette and a free form.

results.title: Chopper [DVD] (D)
results.creator_credit: Andrew Dominik, Michele Bennett and Palace Films
results.brief_description: This AFI award winning film is based on the life of Mark Brandon - “Chopper” - Read, a notorious Australian criminal who became a best selling author, publishing 9 books of his life and times as a key stand man in Melbourne’s underworld. Eric Bana plays Chopper following his conviction for abducting a judge who was proceeding over the case of his best friend, Jimmy Loughnan (Simon Lyndon). Read ends up serving a 16 year sentence for his efforts, during which he shares a cell with Jimmy and has to contend with Keithy George (David Field), a crime boss who runs the prison. After an attack of violence instigated by Chopper, he kills Keithy and finds himself the target of numerous prisoners wishing revenge on him. As he sees it, the only way to escape the notorious H division is to get his friend to chop his ears off so that he can be transferred to another prison. Eight years later, Chopper is released and finds himself battling his own personal demons and psychotic episodes to try and adjust to outside life. All he can focus on is seeking revenge on arch enemy Neville Bartos (Vince Colosimo) and looking out for his girlfriend, Tanya (Kate Beahan). This special edition includes deleted scenes, theatrical trailer and footage of director Andrew Dominik and Eric Bana’s visit to Chopper in Tasmania while researching the film.

results.title: Chocky
results.creator_credit: Christopher Hodson, Vic Hughes and Thorn EMI
results.brief_description: Matthew Gore’s life is just like any other 12 year olds, until he meets ‘Chocky’. What makes Chocky different from Matthew’s other friends is that she cannot be seen, speaks inside Matthew’s head and is an explorer from another world. Matthew develops new physical and mental capabilities through Chocky’s guidance, however it also isolates him from family and friends and eventually throws him into the media spotlight. Matthew is forced to make some adult decisions about his unique friend and their relationship. Based on the novel by renowned science fiction writer John Wyndham.

results.title: China mission
results.creator_credit: Tom Radford, Lydia Semotuk, Michael Scott and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A biography of Chester Ronning told through the use of mostly contemporary stills and some silent footage. Chester Ronning was born in Francheng, China, in 1894, the son of Norwegian missionaries. Until his death at the age of ninety, he was everything from a cowboy to an ambassador, a college president to a Peace River homesteader, a missionary to a member of the Alberta legislature. But Ronning, who died in December 1984, is best remebered in international circles for his long and close relationship with China. Throughout his many careers, including that of Canadian High Commissioner to India, ambassador to Norway, and head of an international mission in 1966 to end the war in Vietnam, Ronning’s lifelong ambition was to explain China to the western world. His story is a rare example of the meeting of east and west in a compassionate, remarkable man. Narrated by Cedric Smith. (Awards: San Antonio; San Francisco).

results.title: Chillysmith farm
results.creator_credit: Dan Jury, Mark Jury and Valley Filmworks
results.brief_description: Chillysmith Farm was the home of Gramp, whose last years were documented by his grandsons in the photo essay ‘Gramp’. In this film, 10 years in the making, Gramp and other members of his family are shown. Birth and death are shown by the whole family. This is a film for all ages that raises issues of family life, birth, death, and individual responsibility of the ageing.
